title: How to Make Simple Lentil Soup

steps.headline: Put the lentils in a bowl.
Add 2 liters (0.5 US gal) of hot water.
Microwave for 10 to 20 minutes.
steps.description: Blend the lentil until it has a nice consistency. Garnish with lemon juice and dill leaves/coriander leaves.

steps.headline: Place the onion, carrots and celery into the heavy-based pot.
Cook on medium-high heat.
steps.description: When the onions are clear, add the garlic and cook for half a minute.

steps.headline: Add the dried herbs, pepper and salt.
steps.description: Add the lentils.

steps.headline: Pour the water into the pot.
steps.description: Bring to the boil.

steps.headline: Reduce the heat.
steps.description: Simmer for 40 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the tomatoes.
steps.description: Simmer for another 5 to 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Serve with crusty bread.

steps.headline: Heat the olive oil on medium-high heat.
steps.description: Add the garlic, onions, carrot and celery to a heavy-based saucepan or pot. Sauté until soft.

steps.headline: Add salt and pepper to taste.
Add the lentils, bay leaf and broth.
steps.description: Bring to the boil.

steps.headline: Reduce to a simmer.
steps.description: Cook for about 30 minutes, or until the lentils soften.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Test to see if it has adequate salt. Adjust is needed.

steps.headline: Pour into bowls.
steps.description: Serve with crusty bread.

steps.headline: Add the washed lentils to a heavy-based saucepan or pot.
steps.description: Pour in the cold water.

steps.headline: Bring to the boil.
steps.description: Reduce to a simmer. Simmer gently for 1 hour or until the lentils are soft. Skim as required.

steps.headline: Wash the spinach.
steps.description: If using large leaves, cut down the middle, then chop roughly. Baby spinach can be left as it is.

steps.headline: Heat the oil in a frying pan or skillet.
steps.description: Add the onion and fry until translucent.

steps.headline: Add the garlic and cook for another 30 seconds.
steps.description: Add the shredded spinach or baby spinach leaves. Stir to combine well.

steps.headline: Tip the onion and spinach mixture into the lentils.
steps.description: Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour in the lemon juice.

steps.headline: Cover.
steps.description: Simmer gently for 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Pour into deep serving bowls.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Add a wedge to the side for squeezing into the soup. Serve with crusty bread or flat bread.

text: Simple red lentil soup (microwave) Put the lentils in a bowl.  Add 2 liters (0.5 US gal) of hot water.  Add the salt.  Microwave for 10 to 20 minutes. Blend the lentil until it has a nice consistency. Garnish with lemon juice and dill leaves/coriander leaves. Finished.  Simple brown lentil soup Prepare the vegetables as required.  Place the onion, carrots and celery into the heavy-based pot.  Cook on medium-high heat. When the onions are clear, add the garlic and cook for half a minute. Add the dried herbs, pepper and salt. Add the lentils. Pour the water into the pot. Bring to the boil. Reduce the heat. Simmer for 40 minutes. Add the tomatoes. Simmer for another 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat. Serve with crusty bread. Simple lentil soup with bay Heat the olive oil on medium-high heat. Add the garlic, onions, carrot and celery to a heavy-based saucepan or pot. Sauté until soft. Add salt and pepper to taste.  Add the lentils, bay leaf and broth. Bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer. Cook for about 30 minutes, or until the lentils soften. Remove from the heat. Test to see if it has adequate salt. Adjust is needed. Pour into bowls. Serve with crusty bread. Simple lentil and spinach soup Wash the lentils and drain.  Add the washed lentils to a heavy-based saucepan or pot. Pour in the cold water. Bring to the boil. Reduce to a simmer. Simmer gently for 1 hour or until the lentils are soft. Skim as required. Wash the spinach. If using large leaves, cut down the middle, then chop roughly. Baby spinach can be left as it is. Heat the oil in a frying pan or skillet. Add the onion and fry until translucent. Add the garlic and cook for another 30 seconds. Add the shredded spinach or baby spinach leaves. Stir to combine well. Tip the onion and spinach mixture into the lentils. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour in the lemon juice. Cover. Simmer gently for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the heat. Pour into deep serving bowls. Serve. Add a wedge to the side for squeezing into the soup. Serve with crusty bread or flat bread.
